head.title: Eureka! A Key to the Code of Life

hedline.hl1: Eureka! A Key to the Code of Life

abstract.p: Dr Jay H Kleiman letter on June 27 article on sequencing of human genome warns social policies must catch up with scientific revolution; drawing

block.p: Re ''Genetic Code of Human Life Is Cracked by Scientists'' (front page, June 27):
Re ''Genetic Code of Human Life Is Cracked by Scientists'' (front page, June 27):

The breathtaking sequencing of the human genome gives mankind access to knowledge with immense potential. Hand in hand come burdensome responsibilities. Two clear dangers are present. First, commercial exploitation must not become the driving force in its application. Second, fear of misapplication cannot be allowed to prevent realization of the full benefits that these new insights offer.

Processes are needed to balance the divergent perspectives and interests that will seek application of these breakthroughs. Social policies must catch up with the scientific revolution. The challenge of forging such policies will prove as daunting and as crucial as sequencing the genome itself.
JAY H. KLEIMAN, M.D. Skokie, Ill., June 27, 2000
The writer is a cardiologist working in pharmaceutical research.
